intro: Viguiera ayutlana, commonly known as Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and clustered in conical inflorescences. Viguiera ayutlana is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in arid environments.
